snippet: Forestalling violence by keeping closer tabs on those with mental illness is an appealing idea, but it poses more difficulties than are at first apparent.
abstract: Warning signs by deeply disturbed people who may commit violent acts are often unclear, and reveal how broken the mental health system is; several ideas being discussed in proposed federal and New York State legislation to reduce gun violence in wake of cases like Newtown, Conn, shootings are deeply contentious and transcend political differences.

byline.original: By BENEDICT CAREY and ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS

lead_paragraph: Forestalling violence by keeping closer tabs on those with mental illness is an appealing idea, but it poses more difficulties than are at first apparent.

headline.seo: Breaking Link of Violence and Mental Illness
